author.name: Rahul Katariya
author.bio: I'm a Senior Software Engineer with over eight years of experience specialising in Apple and Frontend technologies. I have finished my Masters in MSc Software Engineering with Foundations of Machine Learning at The University of Manchester. Currently, I am working as a Senior Software Engineer at Zuhlke, Manchester.

events.title: Data Modeler
events.subtitle: Closed Source
events.overview: A iOS/macOS App built using SwiftUI and Combine built for developers to design their business domain and capture json data.

events.title: Buddycode
events.subtitle: Closed Source
events.overview: A macOS App built using SwiftUI and Combine built for Architects to generate high quality code.

events.title: iOS Fastfile
events.subtitle: Open Source
events.overview: My generic fastlane setup that takes care of associated groups, extensions, code signing using match for both developer and enterprise applications

events.title: Swift Framework Template
events.subtitle: Open Source
events.overview: A template for new Swift iOS / macOS / tvOS / watchOS Framework project ready with travis-ci, cocoapods, Carthage, SwiftPM and a Readme file

events.title: Restofire
events.subtitle: Open Source
events.overview: Restofire is a protocol oriented networking client for Alamofire

events.title: Senior iOS Engineer
events.subtitle: PhonePe
points: Implemented Uber RIBs pattern in Onboarding module
Developed and maintained Gold, Store Discovery, Billpay and Recharge modules
Developed patterns to create UIViews in a composable, reactive manner.
Led and managed the iOS Team to iteratively deliver UI Module of the application.

events.title: iOS Engineer
events.subtitle: Hike
points: Re-designed iCloud Backup and Restore module in Swift
Fixed bugs and added new features in Onboarding and Chat modules
Automated the deployment of the Hike iOS application using fastlane
Setup CI/CD pipeline using Circle CI
Led and managed the QA team to develop XCUITests

events.title: iOS Engineer
events.subtitle: Pronto IT Labs
points: Built Employer and JobSeeker Apps from scratch and published to AppStore
Mentored and reviewed code of team members
Won TieCon Hackathon for building an indoor location map using iBeacon and CoreLocation

events.title: iOS Engineer
events.subtitle: Xebia
points: Fixed bugs and added new features in DRA and SIMN applications
Participated in Intel IoT Hackathon and built a smart soul with knock sensor, Edison board and BLE

events.title: Technologist
events.subtitle: Empeiria
points: Took Stanford University's CS193p (Developing Applications for iOS)
Built TBNEurope application from scratch and published to AppStore
Built Montcalm application from scratch and published to AppStore

events.title: Restofire Design and Motivation
events.subtitle: NSManchester @ Aereworks
events.overview: Talked about Restofire from a business point of view where we have low investment and high returns.

events.title: Advanced Swift Workshop
events.subtitle: try! Swift, Bangalore
events.overview: Conducted a full day workshop on Advanced Swift Concepts
points: Functional Programming - Map, Filter and Reduce
Protocols and Generics, Type Erasures
Value vs Reference, Copy On Write
Memory Management - Memory Layout, Unsafe Swift

events.title: Progressive iOS Architectures
events.subtitle: Swift India @ PhonePe
events.overview: Talked about how to start with MVC and mix and match patterns like Coordinator, Interactor and Router as the complexity grows.

events.title: Library Oriented Programming
events.subtitle: Swift India @ Hike
events.overview: Talked about how to build and integrate libraries using Swift inside Xcode.

events.title: Networking using Restofire
events.subtitle: Swift India @ Hike
events.overview: Talked about Declarative Networking in Swift using Restofire

events.title: Networking using Restofire
events.subtitle: Thoughtworks, Gurgaon
events.overview: Talked about Declarative Networking in Swift using Restofire
